Yes, Apple's leadership has made several notable company-wide changes in response to the pandemic, including:

1. Remote work: Apple announced that its employees could work remotely when applicable, with CEO Tim Cook stating that "flexibility will be key" during these times.

2. Retail stores: Apple closed all of its retail stores worldwide, except for those located in Greater China. The company has slowly reopened its stores with health and safety precautions in place, such as mandatory face coverings and temperature checks.

3. Donations: Apple has donated millions of dollars to COVID-19 relief efforts, including $15 million to the global COVID-19 response and $10 million to the "One World: Together at Home" virtual benefit concert.

4. Product development: Apple has shifted its focus to products that are useful during the pandemic, such as expanding its health features in the Apple Watch and developing a COVID-19 screening app in partnership with the CDC.

5. Financial assistance: Apple has offered financial assistance to its suppliers in need and has extended payment terms for small business partners. The company has also provided options for customers to defer payments on their Apple Card without accruing interest.
